result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony W Ehlert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with 6 days credit.
Extended Supervision and Probation conditions the same.
Concurrent with: The Probation ordered in case # 14CF1868. COURT ALLOWS FOR DOSAGE PROBATION.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $396.18 payable to Burnell and Yolanda Y, $400.00 payable to State Farm - both from joint and several with Marell Fullilove (case # 14CF1322).
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm.

No possession/consumption/selling/distribution or illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with: 
Burnell Y., Yolanda Y., Lakendra C., or co-defendant Marzell Fullilove.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work. Court objects to electronic monitoring. Court stayed commencement until 1/30/2015 at 5:00pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony W Ehlert

records.addlTxt:
The Petition for Sentence Adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest

-  The court has reviewed the defendant's petition for sentence adjustment and his accompanying documents, and concludes that sentence adjustment is not appropriate.  While the court appreciates the defendant's letter and encourages him to continue in his educational and work pursuits as described in his letter, the court also notes that the defendant is serving a term of reconfinement after having been revoked.  The court further notes that this is the defendant's second revocation in his case, as the sentencing court originally stayed his sentence in favor of probation.  Under these circumstances, the court finds that sentence adjustment is not warranted.

-  signed by the Court (electronically)

Copy to be mailed to defendant
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. cmc
Defendant's Petition for Sentence Adjustment.  (Anthony W. Ehlert - #625671, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, PO Box 05740, Milwaukee WI 53205-0740).
Received & Filed, Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (9 pages) commencing 01/21/2015 by Court Reporter Kathleen Worden.
Case converted at request of Court Reporter Kathleen Worden.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order DENYING request for release on eclectronic monitoring signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring so he can take care of his kids.
Dosage Probation Approved

Defendant Anthony W Ehlert in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 21.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS with 6 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1.5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation to run CONCURRENT with the probation ordered in case# 14CF1868.  COURT ALLOWS FOR DOSAGE PROBATION

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 6 MONTHS condition time with Huber for work.  Court objects to electronic monitoring.   Court stayed commencement until 01/30/2015 at 5:00pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: Burnell Y, Yolanda Y, Lakendra C, or co-defendant Marzell Fullilove.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $396.18 payable to Burnell and Yolanda Y, $400 payable to State Farm- both joint and several with Marell Fullilove (case# 14CF1322); 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Anthony W Ehlert in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to Court's congested calendar, matter rescheduled for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing Memorandum filed by defense.

Defendant Anthony W Ehlert in court with attorney Caitlin Firer.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing hearing.  Attorney Firer informs the court that this case has been administratively reassigned as Attorney Morrisey is no longer employed with the public defender's office.  Defense motion for adjournment granted by the court. Defendant Anthony W Ehlert in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
filed.

Defendant Anthony W Ehlert in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony W Ehlert in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony W Ehlert in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony W Ehlert in court with Attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Status conference held between counsel.  Defendant has new case pending.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony W Ehlert in court with Attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Defendant Anthony W Ehlert in custody.  Ben Lindsay for Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Status conference scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Megan L Morrisey in court.  Benjamin Lindsay for Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the court for Arraignment.  Defendant appeared in court on today.  Prior to the case being called the defendant was taken into custody by the Milwaukee Police Department.  
  Arraignment scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Court orders case adjourned for arraignment in Branch 21.

Defendant Anthony W Ehlert in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Anthony W Ehlert in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Arraignment scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
